paragraphs.text: I can name several urban farming initiatives in Tokyo that started over a decade ago and between that time and now, initiatives throughout the Caribbean and Africa and Latin America before 2010. This is not inclusive of urban rooftop farming that been around for…

897b71789eea.title: I love the fact that this is a totally thorough piece.

paragraphs.text: I love the fact that this is a totally thorough piece. Great job. I love the fact that agritech is becoming more abundant.
paragraphs.name: c721

paragraphs.text: Now, on the other side, I have to say that I cringe when I think of Silicon Valley taking on farming. My belief is that when these companies get investors it becomes more about profit and elite needs…

paragraphs.text: Great look at food culture and production in the 21st century. As a former chef, who has followed everything from farms to tables for as long as I can remember, the important reminder in all the news…

7207040cea89.title: Well researched and written piece. The writing here is generally very good- and this is up a notch.

paragraphs.text: Well researched and written piece. The writing here is generally very good- and this is up a notch.

Having an active interest in food…., and being involved professionally in food more than a few times as a designer, it is refreshing to find well rounded examination of the ups and downs of ‘Silicon Valley’ type VC funded food…

196e6c87f76a.title: Great article and thank you for the work it took to put it all together.

paragraphs.text: Great article and thank you for the work it took to put it all together. I “farm” or garden on small city lot. While some will be able to monetize I fear most won’t. Salads and kale are not the future of food but they are the entry for the urban entrepenuer. Some will be successful and that is great. Yet, I really don’t think that should be the point…
paragraphs.name: aab6

af7f1b8fe38b.title: A very through article that points out the elephant in the room: how do you feed the world when…

paragraphs.text: A very through article that points out the elephant in the room: how do you feed the world when organic and technological improvements seem to have an upper limit without just taking up as much room as their traditional farming brethren? For all that they tout about the benefits of organic farming, that to me is the biggest question: how do you scale…
paragraphs.name: bc05

virtuals.subtitle: It may come down to that we need a lot more people wanting to work in urban, organic, and traditional farming methods.

content.subtitle: It may come down to that we need a lot more people wanting to work in urban, organic, and traditional farming methods.

paragraphs.text: Very well-written and informative piece. I remember a lot of talk about doing this in Detroit a few years back with all the vacant space. It will be interesting to see what happens going forward.
paragraphs.name: fc59
